question: In LabVIEW, what is a good way of transferring multiple data types at once? (a single answer is correct)
Which types of data can a case structure use as a selector? (More than one answer may be correct).
Which indicator, illustrated in the code below, will display data first? (a single answer is correct)
Which of the following statements regarding signal conditioning are correct? (More than one answer may be correct).

options.A: Attenuation of a signal is required for measuring small voltage signals.
options.B: Signal conditioning can be utilized to correct for the nonlinearity of sensors.
options.C: Electrical Isolation protects both operators of Data Acquisition (DAQ) equipment and the equipment itself.
options.D: Multiplexors makes Data Acquisition (DAQ) systems expensive and should be avoided for high channel count applications.

question: A Data Acquisition system has been developed to monitor the deflection of an aircraft wing for a dynamic test. Sensors are placed on the wing and 20m of cabling is used to pass the sensor signals to a central Data Acquisition (DAQ) system. The signals of interest are under 30Hz and there is a problem with high frequency noise in the measurements. Which of the following solutions could solve the problem? (More than one answer may be correct).

options.A: Applying a high pass filter to the sensor signals before they reach the DAQ system
options.B: Applying a low pass filter to the sensor signals before they reach the DAQ system
options.C: Applying an amplifier to the sensor signal before sending it through the cabling.
options.D: Applying a second order Butterworth filter with a cut off frequency of 40Hz

question: Which of the following statements about an optical quadrature encoder with 300 counts per revolution are correct? (More than one answer may be correct).

options.C: Differentiating the signal encoder output will produce a noiseless angular velocity signal.
options.D: The output of the encoder will be a analogue signal.

question: Which of the following statements about ultrasonic sensors is correct? (A single answer is correct).

options.A: Ultrasonic sensors use ultrasound at a frequency of 2KHz.
options.B: Two ultrasonic sensors cannot interfere with each other.
options.C: The bearing of the ultrasonic sensor will have a finite uncertainty.
options.D: Environmental noise can affect an ultrasonic sensor.

question: Which of the following statements are correct? (More than one answer may be correct).

options.A: Foil strain gauges are immune to electro-magnetic noise.
options.B: Aliasing is caused by a sampling rate which is too low for the frequencies being measured.
options.C: Quadrature rotary encoders can be used to determine the direction of a shaft’s rotation.
options.D: The Sensitivity of a system is defined as the slope of the output characteristic curve.

question: What is the resolution (code width) of a 12-bit ADC with a voltage signal range of 0V to +5V? (A single answer is correct)
What is the result in subarray after the code illustrated below has been executed? (A single answer is correct)
Determine how many bits an analogue to digital convertor must provide to output increments of 0.02V or less. The reference voltage is 10V. (A single answer is correct)
Which of the following statements are correct? (More than one answer may be correct)

options.A: The highest number that can be represented using an 8-bit representation is 256.
options.B: The 6-bit binary number 001011 represents the decimal number 11.
options.C: Sensors which utilize digital signals as outputs are less susceptible to low voltage noise induced in the transmission wiring.
options.D: Multiplexers can be utilized in DAQ systems to increase the sample rate.

question: Inspect the LabVIEW code below. Identify which of the statements a) – d) are correct. (More than one answer may be correct)

options.B: Values will be inserted into ‘Output Array’ corresponding to the iteration terminal value multiplied by 2.
options.C: The Loop will execute once per second.
options.D: The ‘DBL’ function will output a value equivalent to the iteration terminal value multiplied by two.

question: Inspect the LabVIEW code below. Which of the statements a) – d) are correct? (More than one answer may be correct)

options.A: The top loop will execute at 3 times.
options.B: The bottom loop will not execute.
options.C: The bottom loop will execute at twice the speed of the top loop.
options.D: ‘Indicator 3’ will display a value of three when the code finishes executing.

question: Which of the following statements are correct? (More than one answer may be correct)

options.A: To reduce problems associated with aliasing you should apply a low pass filter at half the sampling frequency.
options.B: Aliasing means that frequencies at greater than half the sampling frequency will appear as frequencies below half the sampling frequency.
options.C: The resolution of a system is the smallest increment it can measure.
options.D: Buffered I/O should be used when the sample rate needs to be variable.

question: The LabVIEW code below illustrates a For loop. What will be the output of ‘Indicator’ when the loop finishes? (A single answer is correct)
Which of the following statements are correct? (More than one answer may be correct)

options.A: The four standard elements of a DAQ device are Analogue Output, Analogue Input, Digital I/O, Counters.
options.B: Potentiometers are ill suited to measuring continuous revolutions of the wheels of a mobile robot.
options.C: Sensors utilizing modulated infrared signals can detect a signal even if the strength is low.
options.D: In general, an analogue sensor is less susceptible to noise than a sensor with a digital output.

question: Which of the following statements are correct? (A single answer is correct)

options.A: A For Loop must execute at least once
options.B: A For Loop can have a conditional terminal
options.C: You cannot have a While Loop within a While Loop.
options.D: A While Loop can only execute 100 times.

question: Which of the following statements about race conditions is correct? (A single answer is correct)

options.A: Most race conditions only occur when a resource has multiple writers.
options.B: Race conditions only occur when a resource has multiple readers.
options.C: You can avoid race conditions by using variables.
options.D: Code with race conditions behaves the same every time it is executed.

question: Which of the following statements are correct? (More than one answer may be correct)

options.A: SubVIs are an efficient way of programming as they can be reused.
options.B: SubVIs enable quicker code debugging as their modularity enables quick testing.
options.C: The resolution of a data acquisition card is dependent on the bit length e.g. 12bit, 16bit.
options.D: Hysteresis is a desirable attribute of data acquisition card.
